meanings.definition: A title or caption at the top of a page or section of a book.
meanings.sent1: The heading of the chapter gave a hint about its content.
meanings.sent2: Please write your name in the heading of the assignment.
meanings.sent3: The heading of the story was so intriguing that I couldn't stop reading.
meanings.sent4: The heading of the article caught my attention immediately.
meanings.sent5: The heading of the document was bold and easy to spot.

meanings.definition: The direction in which a ship or aircraft is pointed.
meanings.sent1: The captain adjusted the heading of the ship to avoid the storm.
meanings.sent2: The compass showed the correct heading towards the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The heading of the boat made the passengers feel the wind in their hair.
meanings.sent4: The heading of the plane was steady despite the turbulence.
meanings.sent5: The heading of the yacht led us to a beautiful hidden cove.

meanings.definition: A course or direction in which something is moving or pointing.
meanings.sent1: The heading of the river was towards the waterfall.
meanings.sent2: The storm changed the heading of the clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The heading of the arrow was slightly off target.
meanings.sent4: The heading of the car was straight down the highway.
meanings.sent5: The heading of the flock of birds painted a mesmerizing pattern in the sky.
